benchmark_details.name: UCVL (A Benchmark for Crime Surveillance Video Analysis with Large Models)
benchmark_details.overview: UCVL is the first benchmark designed to evaluate the capabilities of Multimodal Large Language Models in video anomaly analysis, offering a diverse range of tasks and question types.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a rigorous evaluation framework for Multimodal Large Language Models in the context of analyzing crime surveillance videos.

data.source: UCF-Crime and UCF-Crime Annotation datasets, reorganized annotations, and new QA pairs generated.
data.annotation: Automatically generated QA pairs from human annotations using large language models.

methods: Evaluation of Multimodal Large Language Models with diverse question types
Human evaluation for open-ended responses using GPT-4o
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the model's responses compared to ground truth annotations.
methodology.interpretation: Scores are normalized to a scale of 0-100, reflecting the model's predictive capabilities and understanding of video anomalies.
methodology.baseline_results: Results benchmarked against eight prevalent models with varying parameter sizes.
methodology.validation: Evaluated across test sets to ensure reliability and performance consistency.
